EditorData.logicalname: FAIL / NOT MET / ZEV NOT LEAD

Text.Value: I don't see Zevlor. Don't tell me he's missing aswell?
I heard you were ambushed by the cult. It sounded brutal.
Aye, I did. Maybe you'd have been the one to save us all, if you'd been there.

EditorData.NodeContext: No pretense - she openly accepts she abandoned some people, but has to be pragmatic.

Text.Value: Your life is your own - you owe these people nothing. You were right to run.
I heard you were ambushed by the cult. It sounded brutal.
Heroism is no comfort to the dead.

EditorData.NodeContext: a touch sharp, she's not annoyed, more surprised the player would be so naive

Text.Value: I owe you an apology. You pulled my people from one death-trap, only for me to land them in another.

EditorData.NodeContext: Growing serious - in her mind, she messed up the chance we gave her

Text.Value: You didn't stand your ground? You deserted your allies? Disgraceful.
We're bruised, battered... but we're together again. You damn well brought them back.

EditorData.NodeContext: Fiercely grateful

Text.Value: I promised you a drink the next time we met. This inn isn't what I had in mind.

EditorData.NodeContext: Smiling, happy to see us, but muted. She's suffered tragedy since we last saw her.

Text.Value: I prefer setting traps over walking into them - what happened?
Still, you're here. Better than being a prisoner of the Absolute.
Thought you'd be ten yards tall, the way my people speak of you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Blunt, eyeing us up (friendly, not unimpressed - but muted due to circumstances)

Text.Value: I don't see Zevlor. Don't tell me he's missing aswell?
Aye - brutal is putting it lightly. Maybe we should have just surrendered, but...
You let your fear conquer you. Be careful not to let your life be ruled by it.
Don't lose hope. The others might still be alive.
Do you think the cult planned this? Or was it a surprise attack?
I thought we might pass unnoticed along the fringes of this place. Escape the owlbear by hiding in its shadow, so to speak.
You can see exactly how well that went.

EditorData.NodeContext: Making light of her own foolish plan. Not jokey, just tired - her failure is self-evident

Text.Value: I was trying to scout a path for us while you got busy carving one. But don't worry, I've had my fill of fighting since.

EditorData.NodeContext: wry, but ending on a somber note

Text.Value: So you managed to miss all that trouble at the grove. Convenient.
The inn is old, but 'death-trap' is a bit much.
What the hells happened? Where is everyone?
Sounds like you made a right mess of things.
I don't see Zevlor. Don't tell me he's missing aswell?
Thought you'd be ten yards tall, the way Zevlor spoke of you.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Met.
EditorData.NodeContext: Blunt, eyeing us up (friendly, not unimpressed - but muted due to circumstances)

Text.Value: Glad you've kept your humour. The others could use it - what's left of us.

EditorData.NodeContext: Smiling at our joke - less at the content than the fact we can joke at all.

Text.Value: Leave.
Seems not everyone made it out of that tower. But it'd be none at all with you - thank you. Truly.

EditorData.NodeContext: A little mournful, but still grateful

Text.Value: ...That's that, then.
We were ambushed out in the cursed lands - cultists of this Absolute. Zevlor froze, begged us to surrender, but...
Zevlor had hope. It didn't save him. A little sense will serve us better, I think.

EditorData.NodeContext: Not overly forceful, just refusing to be swayed from the grim reality. Small sigh.

Text.Value: This army of the Absolute is growing, and flowing towards Moonrise. There's worse than goblins on the roads now.

EditorData.NodeContext: Ominous, frustrated. They met much more resistance than she imagined

Text.Value: We were bound for Baldur's Gate, and what's left of us is damn well getting there.

EditorData.NodeContext: Fierce - she won't let any more die

Text.Value: Or maybe you'd be missing along with the rest.

EditorData.NodeContext: Stark - not trying to provoke or insult us, just stating facts

Text.Value: They are gone, you have been spared. Do not squander the gods' grace.
Cultists, curse - it matters not. The past is done. Focus on moving forward.
To despair is fruitless. To hope is divine - do not give up.
I almost hope he never found out why.

EditorData.NodeContext: Vaguely shuddering at the thought of what the cult would need prisoners for

Text.Value: What exactly have I left to squander?
Move forward to what exactly?
Hope? You would bid me hope?
Aye. Not a battle she's likely to put to song. Maybe we should have just surrendered, but...
We were ambushed out in the cursed lands - cultists of this Absolute. Likely we should have surrendered, but...
What happened? Where's Zevlor?
We've no brighter horizon ahead of us. There's just the city - if I can get us there alive.
Have you no shame? You were tasked with protecting these people, yet you ran.
Those of us who cut free just kept running 'til we found this place. The others... maybe the cult got them. Maybe the curse.

EditorData.NodeContext: Shrugging, helpless. It's not that she doesn't care what happened to them, but she's exhausted and knows there's little she can do

Text.Value: I almost hope the others never found out why.

EditorData.NodeContext: Vaguely shuddering at the thought of what the cult would need prisoners for

Text.Value: Prison's the best I can hope for the ones we left behind. This cult seemed to want us alive.

EditorData.NodeContext: Grim, pragmatic

Text.Value: Watch your back out there. If it's not the cult coming for you, it'll be the shadows.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Not Met.

Text.Value: I tried, but your people didn't make it out of Moonrise. I'm sorry.
How did you blunder into danger this time?
So you abandoned them.
You did right. You do not want to be a prisoner of the Absolute.
...I suppose I deserve that.

EditorData.NodeContext: A little stiff - primed to take offense but relaxes, accepts the insult is probably warranted

Text.Value: I looked for Zevlor among those who came back. No matter his fate... I know he'd be grateful to you. I am too.

EditorData.NodeContext: A little mournful, but still grateful

Text.Value: I'll make sure the others know you tried, but nothing's changed.

EditorData.NodeContext: Trying to set grief aside.

Text.Value: Cerys. Scout. Seems we missed one another at the grove, but the others told me how you helped us.
The others are dead.
Glad to see you again. I was afraid you'd get swallowed up by the shadows. Instead, you've found us some cavalry. Very well done.
Aye - brutal is putting it lightly. Maybe we should have just surrendered - Zevlor begged us to. But...
We're in a dilapidated inn, surrounded by cursed darkness - only a fool wouldn't be afraid.
They were toying with us. Making examples. And we'd had enough of taking it.
Coward.
'Death-trap'? I've slept in worse inns, trust me.
Rolan said his siblings were taken. What happened out there?
Aye. Don't blame him for drinking this place dry.

EditorData.NodeContext: grim

Text.Value: A pity. You pulled them from one death-trap only for me to land them in this one.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sighing, looking around at the inn. She's exhausted and guilty in equal measure.

Text.Value: You've the look of someone with news. Good or bad?
It's hard to tell. We were alone in the darkness one moment, surrounded the next.
Aye. Not a battle she's likely to put to song. Maybe we should have just surrendered - Zevlor begged us to. But...
What are you doing out here to begin with? You were bound for Baldur's Gate.
The time for hoping is past. I've got to get what's left of us to the city.

EditorData.NodeContext: Not overly forceful, just refusing to be swayed from the grim reality. Small sigh.

Text.Value: Sorry for what? Doing more for them than I did?

EditorData.NodeContext: Quiet anger and sorrow, but not directed at us

Text.Value: I'll catch up with you later. I have some... funeral rites to prepare.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bracing herself for a sad task - just heard of the deaths of her friends

Text.Value: Prison's the best I can hope for the ones we left behind. Zevlor seemed to think the cult wanted us alive.

EditorData.NodeContext: Grim, pragmatic

Text.Value: Aye, and more than half the others with him.
This place has been buzzing with talk of an adventurer who found us an angel. Sounds like salvation to me, don't you think?
Have hope. You survived - I'm sure the others did too.
But... thanks. It was sweet of you try.

EditorData.NodeContext: Small smile. She's not one for sweetness, but finds our sheer unearned optimism endearing.

Text.Value: The end's in sight. I can feel it.
Gone, and more than half the others with him.

Synopsis: Cerys, a tiefling scout, is now present in Last Light along with the others who evaded capture by the cultists. She has reluctantly assumed the role of leader in Zevlor's absence (assuming she hadn't already). She's exhausted by the responisibility but still capable of a little gallows humour.
